subject: Critical Thinking
title: Act vs. Rule Utilitarianism: Follow the Rule or Break It?
description: A fast breakdown of Act vs. Rule Utilitarianism: Follow the Rule or Break It? for builders.

hook.text: Lying is usually bad. But lying to a murderer about where your friend is hiding? Act utilitarianism says: lie.

buildup.text: Act utilitarianism: evaluate EACH action individually.

discovery.text: Rule utilitarianism: 'If everyone followed this rule, would happiness increase?' 'Don't lie' generally works â€“ even if.

twist.text: Act utilitarianism is more flexible but prone to rationalization: 'THIS lie is justified.' Rule utilitarianism is.

climax.text: Most institutions use rule utilitarianism while individuals use act utilitarianism. Both have trade-offs.

punchline.text: Rules exist because individual calculations fail. But sometimes, rules fail too.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between act and rule utilitarianism?
options: Act utilitarianism evaluates each action individually; rule utilitarianism follows generally beneficial rules
